answers.answer: Hello,Fungal infections, impetigo and warts are all contagious diseases and can be spread by touch. Various reasons for recurrent or persistent fungal infection are incomplete treatment, treatment resistance, co-existing dermatitis, diabetes and low immunity.Get your and your daughter’s blood sugar levels checked.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I am wondering if anyone can help me with something. Throughout my life I have had planters warts on feet and fingers various different times, athletes food mostly when I was younger but had it not too long ago, Chronic yeast infections for 20yrs and ringworm.My daughter of 9yrs has also had athletes foot, warts and impetigo.Is there some sort of connection with this?
title: Fungal issues since childhood
